title: Allows certain uniformed personnel serving in foreign countries on behalf of the United States the same protection as other public employees serving in the military
summary: Allows uniformed personnel who serve as interpreters assisting persons in police duty, serving in foreign countries on behalf of the United States government the same protection as other public employees serving in the military.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the military law, in relation to affording uniformed
         personnel who assist police officers, serving in foreign countries  on
         behalf  of  the  United States government the same protection as other
         public employees serving in the military

    6    S 2. Notwithstanding subdivision 4 of section 243 of the military law,

   12  such service, whichever is later, for the purposes of obtaining  retire-
   13  ment credit as provided in such subdivision.
   14    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
